definition: little demon (term of endearment for a child)/mischievous child/imp
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
lit. standing in front of the King of Hell is easy, but smaller devils are difficult to deal with (idiom)
pinyin: Yan2 wang2 hao3 jian4 , xiao3 gui3 nan2 dang1

sentences.english: He even calls her by a cute nickname, "Snips."
sentences.chinese: 他甚至用一個可愛的暱稱，“小鬼頭”來叫她。

sentences.english: I'm a little teapot, short and stout.
sentences.chinese: 我是一把小茶壺，矮矮又胖胖的小鬼。

sentences.english: I will raise you ten because it is Home Alone.
sentences.chinese: 我加十塊，我猜是小鬼當家。

sentences.english: Imps ? Didn't really change at all, though they don't really need to much.
sentences.chinese: 小鬼？完全不用改變它，雖然它的出場率很低。

sentences.english: Sunblade Imps will now reset properly.
You're just a couple of skinny-armed chickens.
sentences.chinese: 你們不過是兩個細胳膊細腿的膽小鬼。

sentences.english: She should can't be also be held up by that little devil last?
sentences.chinese: 她該不會是也被那個小鬼纏上了吧？

sentences.english: It was a comedy called "Home Alone".
sentences.chinese: 這是一部叫《小鬼當家》的喜劇。

sentences.english: Cowards call themselves cautious and misers thrifty.
sentences.chinese: 膽小鬼說自己謹慎，守財奴稱自己節儉。

sentences.english: “You are a coward,” Mr. Brown cried out.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生喊到，“你是個膽小鬼。”

sentences.english: He was the most timorous person in that event.
sentences.chinese: 在那次事件中他是個膽小鬼。

sentences.english: Kill off the Goddamned cowards and we will have a nation of brave men.
sentences.chinese: 幹掉所有狗日的膽小鬼，我們的國家將是勇士的天下。

sentences.english: The imps are a real annoyance for any Hero gifted in magic, as they have the ability to destroy mana from any enemy hero.
sentences.chinese: 小鬼帶給英雄最大的麻煩，就是毀壞魔法值的能力。

sentences.english: Thee coward was backing, his face being deathly pale, toward another room.
sentences.chinese: 那個膽小鬼向另一個房間退去，臉色煞白。

sentences.english: Gary sure is a chicken-livered guy.
You lose the the witch and her two little brats in one swoops .
sentences.chinese: 你忽然間就可以見不到一個巫婆和她的兩個小鬼了。

definition: (literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
